metadata.h1: AI chatbot for sentiment analysis on fake messages.

all_paragraphs: We will go through the architecture that I have built for this solution and try to address the veracity and correctness of forwarded messages in social media.
The corpus is small and extracted from verified facts on PIB official Twitter page.

AI chatbot: As the name suggests, it is an AI software program that imitates human conversation through text or voice interactions. The reason why chatbots are becoming more prominent is because they can work 24x7, save time & money, connect business to customers & employees, home automation etc.

Chatbot approach: Choose if the approach is proactive (i.e. suggestions to the users request) or reactive (just responding to users request). For the fact-check use-case we go with the reactive approach, as we just need to respond telling if the message is a fact or not.
Lets start with the blocks and understand each one in detail:

Design Block: This block controls the conversation flow and mainly focuses on the requests and responses, it is rule based and can also be used for classification of Intents. But, I am limiting the flow to address authenticity of message.

Communication block: As the communication is very light weight, I have used server-less architecture. We can go with Google Cloud Function (or AWS Lambda) to host the code. The API’s can be invoked through REST which simplifies our process.

Deployment block: Handles deployment of the model, dataset, training of the model and cloud infra management. Using official twitter API’s, we fetch new tweets from the official source pages, extracting the data into relevant sections and storing the dataset in DB. The components are containerized for CI/CD. I will be covering this block in a future article in detail.
In a nutshell, this block is responsible for Sentiment analysis of the forwarded message. The execution flow is as below:

4. Transfer learning: We will use the pre-trained vectors which are trained on part of Google News dataset (about 100 billion words). The model contains 300-dimensional vectors for 3 million words and phrases.
5. PCA is applied and principal components are analysed to check if the dataset is having any co-variance, in simple terms we check if there are any common factors or not.

6. Embeddings and Vectorizers: Embeddings are extracted from the pre-trained model and training corpus is vectorized to get an embedding matrix. This embedding layer serves as the initial layer for our Neural Network. This is a Word2Vec representation for extracting the semantic information of words.

7. LSTM & Neural network: Inorder to capture text serialization information, we will use LSTM (RNN based model) to understand the context of sentence, i.e. sequence of words to remember from previous neuron and pass it to the future for further analysing the data.
The word embeddings of the custom dataset is learned while training the neural network.
Accuracy achieved is 98% with the Confusion matrix as below:
Trained Message: Claim: A so-called 3-week, 5-phase “roadmap”, purportedly made by the Government, to ease #COVID19India restrictions is being circulated on Whatsapp.

Whatsapp Forward message: Governments roadmap to ease Covid-19 restriction will be on 3 week review process, the current phases would commence on the following dates: Phase 1–18th May Phase 2–8th June Phase 3–29th June Phase 4–20th July Phase 5–10th August If coronavirus cases begin to increase, we will revert to restrictions set out in the previous stage
Trained Message: Claim: A #WhatsApp forward says there’ll be a military lockdown in Mumbai for 10 days, starting from Saturday
Whatsapp Forward message: Entire Mumbai military lockdown for 10 days from Saturday please stock everything Only milk and medicine will be available
Conclusion: We are able to successfully detect a Whatsapp forward message which is written in different grammar and phrases
